findings.title: Remove Check Allowing transferFrom to Succeed Without Approval if src Refers to msg.sender
findings.description: The transferFrom method moves tokens from one account to another without considering approval if the source of a transferFrom call is the message sender, breaking invariants expected of transferFrom.

findings.title: Don't require "locking" to earn interest on Dai
findings.description: The Dai Savings Rate (DSR) is intended to allow people to lock Dai and thereby earn interest. However, Dai earns interest only when it is locked in the Pot contract.

findings.title: Use two non-ERC20 functions, allowing a user to increase and decrease the approval
findings.description: Race condition in the ERC20 'approve' function may lead to token theft due to the possibility of a spender calling transferFrom before the approve transaction is mined.

findings.title: Implement mechanisms to watch for abuses of the permit method
findings.description: Eve holds onto a permit call signed by Alice, authorizing Eve to spend on Alice's behalf, preventing permit calls signed by Alice with higher nonces from being processed.

findings.title: Modify permit to explicitly disallow having a holder of 0
findings.description: Race condition involving Dai 'permit' nonces allowing Eve to drain Alice's funds by holding onto a permit call signed by Alice and preventing higher nonce permit calls from being processed.

findings.title: Race condition in the ERC20 "approve" function may lead to token theft
findings.description: A race condition in the ERC20 standard's approve function could lead to token theft.
